title: Trump suggests Schiff be arrested over Ukraine statement
text:
Getty Images President Donald Trump speaks during the Armed Forces Welcome Ceremony in honor of the Twentieth Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff on September 30, 2019 at Summerall Field, Joint Base Myer-Henderson Hall, Virginia.

President Donald Trump on Monday questioned if House Intelligence Committee Chairman Adam Schiff should be arrested for treason over his depiction of the president’s call with the leader of Ukraine.

‘ARREST FOR TREASON?’

Trump again defended his July call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and attacked Schiff over his portrayal of it at a hearing last week.

Calling Schiff’s statement “FAKE & terrible,” Trump tweeted “it bore NO relationship to what I said on the call. Arrest for Treason?” At the ceremonial swearing-in of Labor Secretary Eugene Scalia, Trump said he is “trying to find out” the identity of the whistleblower whose complaint alleges that the president sought to push Ukraine to investigate former Vice President Joe Biden and his son.

Now see: Here’s what’s happening next in Democrats’ impeachment inquiry into Trump.

At a Sept. 26 hearing, Schiff characterized the Trump-Zelensky call in a way that he later said was “meant to be at least part in parody.”

“Of course, the president never said, ‘If you don’t understand me, I’m going to say it seven more times.’ My point is that’s the message that the Ukraine president was receiving, in not so many words,” Schiff said.

The call is at the heart of Democrats’ impeachment inquiry. Trump has repeatedly denied wrongdoing. Schiff’s office didn’t immediately return a request for comment.

Now see: Republican lawmaker denounces Trump’s tweet predicting ‘civil war’ if he’s impeached
